F1A92FEEF2044C30BC221610F4BD0B18.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a
word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

C46A846D384A41D6AF861B98AB6FBD67.description: c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

20E1BF3E3E1C40B7A5F74B2F90F55E1B.description: b. Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

1536430287384E3AAE40CAD259726333.description: a. Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

1DD5329355314CFE924B4340B495457E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and
nuances in word meanings.

B76C3FC59B80439481A7FE6FDFA9182E.description: d. Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

88BF057958BA41F992F82977B8D83277.description: c. Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

9247646647DA45F589CCED11F3989321.description: b. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, secede).

937149DF2777438F84B81B252EAF9BCE.description: a. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

4027C1380AD04FCC89235D73525F9F15.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or
phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range
of strategies.

046D6C51026944E292B3CA41AFFF80A6.description: a. Use verbs in the active and passive voice and in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve particular effects (e.g., emphasizing the actor or the action; expressing uncertainty or describing a state contrary to fact).

7320CA08BB114832BEA85CA0A835DD0B.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking,
reading, or listening.

2E3B244D7C494B659A5351AC3D313DCD.description: b. Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission. c. Spell correctly.

576B5054BD9C4689A78C3A3CADD64793.description: a. Use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.

8582D34E1DF14CA4A4E80DA656257B9A.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

EB550F21785B40A2A8B7E1E17FE62C07.description: d. Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood.

6086A4E2A12F49E8BA46453683A389C2.description: c. Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and subjunctive mood.

D17C16A7CF414C698E1D3C288925B873.description: b. Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

D1E951F325BE4B57A3154CC2AAC5D8EC.description: a. Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in general and their function in particular sentences.

DD0F3C3146D54B97A485597B087D0E62.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and
usage when writing or speaking.

4740D7555EB94412A29A0AD5F1BEB261.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of
formal English when indicated or appropriate.

7E8062699706412A9A251521A76C1E51.description:
Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify
information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

B84E0D66630841F4AA93A03D99BC0627.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent
manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen
details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear
pronunciation.

58D75251F9EC41FFB9C321C523A6A934.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness
of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence and identifying
when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

4CB3A854248A4220A363F125BE821E65.description:
Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats
(e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives (e.g., social,
commercial, political) behind its presentation.

3762CEF9D1A34193BD6298EB0BCC2D42.description: d. Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views in light of the evidence presented.

F0B2BE986EF944049B166DCF67B59E0B.description: c. Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

AB9468988E4049E985A017E55AEC03C2.description: b. Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

71389851E68A4BFCB1ED52BF7D849B5D.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

AB9AFAF968F34FE299C1E74EC3F1FFCB.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in
groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 8 topics, texts, and
issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

8DEDC5B96C5742D3B2B9FA10F1982B4F.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range
of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

1C7617F84BA04E198DFEAC7A4BE84E98.description: b. Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced”).

92DDC3136C6646FFACD573C3BAB30D63.description: a. Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new”).

0F5D2FA16C80459D854225BC6756B652.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis,
reflection, and research.

CC40F30B32CC4EA39A005F905B638226.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using
search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source;
and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding
plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

C4DADCA2A3294712967BD60C1E9412CA.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional
related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

8C748C9FDC244A7F91D59539FF504199.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and
present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as
to interact and collaborate with others.

71E4C14C010448E0B909D387E29270C8.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and
strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying
a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been
addressed.

25918685D58245CF8BD02E8AD80E4C1D.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization,
and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

5BE1763D000E4DA4BD88A7B7C90FEC2A.description: e. Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

781AA514A1774CC5A7879ED43BC31449.description: d. Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

375DFABCD6DC492E85EA3D9FF2CD51B9.description: c. Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and events.

4F122532C493461B94EDBC5497FF9FBA.description: b. Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

D894BD211A9442A2A7E5FA3B5D573103.description: a. Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

DB4CD74C2C7C485B9B53B687CD838FE7.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using
effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event
sequences.

873939CB026945EB9F1FC24AB8F49DCC.description: f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

3857D5A9EB9549A8B8089F1B3C502B40.description: e. Establish and maintain a formal style.

68B4949E1E414F2E9C5975F450FA8054.description: d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

924605359ABE45899E1D47DB1EB16DC8.description: c. Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

0EE8A26F2DD44B75A168AB5D5F025CFD.description: b. Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

7F589BE6327B4EB698434BC61ED01282.description: a. Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

265756F824DF4DFB9979DA851F2253B6.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas,
concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of
relevant content.

55DF802585AE4D64B0D98EE22B3A5138.description: e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

D3E67A39160A47FE922EB218FB76F299.description: d. Establish and maintain a formal style.

6937441A66374D5F990C3934FB2237A9.description: c. Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

1B81121BCB6849AABE2F10DD10D84241.description: b. Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

B3598581B21941C4BE09617E1A299B68.description: a. Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

542A4425C59045ADBF59645AE8D29DD9.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

183DD60D27E64770B36386103D8B6D30.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the high
end of the grades 6–8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

C2225336A9FD44659D8129AA8AB3D6D3.description:
Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on
the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or
interpretation.

F8D56E824DD7493A814DD9D464D5C1F6.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g.,
print or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.

64B7FE04D29B420DB2F61FBD9C8F2C64.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the
author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

8D6BBF3E74A942C3A4677B6234854450.description:
Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the
role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

8708BD9B06154F6BB7842B091E8A157E.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text,
including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact
of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

525F18095A7E4DE7B2A673FEBBBFF8B4.description:
Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between
individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or
categories).

6FCFBC20319B4DB297E7613AAF0EAC5D.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the
course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an
objective summary of the text.

6DE5FB297571472EBDCE6C99FBFBBE48.description:
Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the
text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

EACBB602EFDB4778AD9CE4449B0C2A6F.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories,
dramas, and poems, at the high end of grades 6–8 text complexity band
independently and proficiently.

A65DD914D7C942FD839D5DF03F918632.description:
Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events,
or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as
the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new.

0BD05BF6B531432D9A2E1C282FFDB60C.description:
Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama
stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices
made by the director or actors.

DA23A14966754EA28B701AAC01F16568.description:
Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the
audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create
such effects as suspense or humor.

A552699FBDFC4CADB010FC653A74D0F0.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the
differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

FF58883612D942E8975DEDF2C73E95BA.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text,
including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific
word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other
texts.

DB18D39FF4E746A1879D6735BCEB4949.description:
Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama
propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

1D1C848656ED4ADDB40D1AF709BD556B.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over
the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and
plot; provide an objective summary of the text.

06005C848396436299B264A37F864FC3.description:
Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the
text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
